title: Development of Alternating Current (AC) Systems
description: This project explores the development and implementation of alternating current (AC) electrical systems, which revolutionized the transmission of electricity over long distances. The project covers the principles of AC and its advantages over direct current (DC).

title: Wireless Power Transmission
description: A groundbreaking project focusing on the transmission of electrical energy without wires. The research includes experiments conducted at Wardenclyffe Tower and the implications of wireless energy for global communication and power distribution.

title: Tesla Coil Development
description: An in-depth study on the invention of the Tesla Coil, a resonant transformer circuit used for producing high-voltage, low-current, high-frequency alternating current electricity. The project explores its applications in radio transmission, wireless telegraphy, and scientific research.
